programme.desc: In 1992, a young mother was gunned down in front of her children. Police searched for answers, but found none. The horrible crime appeared unmotivated, senseless, and random. Then, family members offered a startling clue. The victim, the wife of a prominent Atlanta attorney, was also a woman burdened with a secret; a secret the FBI believed led to her death. It would force local and federal agents to untangle an intricate web of money, drugs and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Claude Dallas lived the life of a cowboy. A loner and distrustful of authority, he lived off the land, poaching wildlife and selling the hides. But when two game wardens confronted Dallas about his deeds, they were shot and killed. After a massive manhunt, Dallas was captured and convicted, only to escape months later. Making the FBI's Ten Most Wanted list, Dallas eluded the law for almost a year until the FBI tracked him down in a small town in California.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A cunning predator was loose in rural South Carolinaabducting young women from their own front yards in broad daylight. He was also a sadist, calling one victim's family, taunting them, boosting and then dashing their hopes. Local investigators called on the FBI to help them find this clever serial killer. Like a game of chess, FBI profilers and forensic examiners were able to outwit the killer, and put an end to his deadly game of cat and mouse.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in California in 1995, a serial killer targeted vulnerable women. At first charming and generous, he quickly became violent. He was brutal with his kills and quick in his getaways. Traveling across the country, he struck in Mississippi, Louisiana and Florida. The FBI and local police needed to stop this cross-country killer before more women fell victim to his insatiable rage.

With no suspects, local investigators turned to the FBI. Profilers were able to produce a psychological composite of the type of person the killer would most likely be. Their analysis paid off.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: The rapes and murders of ten women near Tampa, Florida in 1984 had the authorities puzzled and the community scared. Since the beginning, the FBI had been analyzing the crime scene evidence and had found a common link: red trilobal carpet fibers. But there was no suspect, until one of the killer's potential victims survived. Through her interviews and the cooperation of local authorities and the FBI, 31-year-old Bobby Joe Long emerged as the prime suspect.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a young boy and his mother were kidnapped and murdered by a vicious drug cartel, FBI agents in the field worked tirelessly to pierce the secretive drug underworld and unearth those involved. Their surveillance and investigative work uncovered a violent trail of murder and greed. FBI agents and forensic examiners pieced together the evidence needed to draw out and then crush the cartel.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenage boy disappeared within hours of each other. Police believed the cases were linked, but didn't know how. They contacted the FBI for help. A trail of stolen vehicles and murder victims across seven states led agents on a hunt for two suspected killers. Their only hope of stopping them was to anticipate the killers' next move.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a chilly afternoon in 1989, Marine Captain Shirley Russell disappeared from Quantico, Virginia. Captain Russell was a dedicated officer; her friends and colleagues were certain she had not gone AWOL. FBI agents found her husband, a former Marine, was acting strangely, and a blood-like stain on the couple's floor disappeared before agents could examine it. There was no body, no witness and no weapon.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Kokomo, Indiana an unthinkable crime terrified residents. A young woman was snatched from her home on a bright spring morning. Drops of blood and a torn window screen were all that was left to tell authorities what happened to the twenty-one year old victim. After several days of searching, a former FBI profiler narrowed the suspect list to one. Agents and detectives followed the trail across state lines hoping to find the victim before her time ran out.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a Delaware woman vanished in 1996, family and friends discovered her secret life. The appointments secretary to the Governor had carried on an illicit affair with a wealthy married man. Agents suspected that her powerful ex-lover was responsible, but they had little physical evidence to support their theory. Investigators never found the woman's body or the murder weapon. The FBI's only hope was to go undercover, and turn brother against brother.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Langley, Virginia, a gunman fired into rush hour traffic. The brazen daytime shooting of employees from the Central Intelligence Agency stunned the country. The victims seemed randomly selected, but the motive appeared to be political. The FBI was called in, but the nationwide search quickly became a far-reaching international manhunt. Agents processed more than 2000 leads and crossed an ocean in the effort to deliver justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: He wandered the streets of New York City wearing only pajamas and a bathrobe, but the FBI was convinced that Vince Gigante, the reputed boss of the Genovese crime family, was anything but crazy. The FBI used undercover surveillance, secret audio tapes, six mobsters turned government informants and the testimony of twelve FBI agents to help convict Gigante of murder and conspiracy-to-murder, including a plot to kill rival mob boss John Gotti.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1980s, the decapitation of a young African-American male led the Miami-Dade police department and the FBI along a trail of murder. Investigators quickly discovered that the victim was a dissident member of a religious sect headed by a man calling himself Yahweh ben Yahweh, or God, Son of God. Although the FBI believed Yahweh ben Yahweh and his followers were responsible for many murders, they could find no direct evidence linking them to the crimes.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

However, police were unsure about the validity of Darlie's story and began an intensive search of the crime scene. programme.desc: In 1995, Lisa Manderach and her daughter Devon left their Pennsylvania home to go shopping, but didn't return home. Lisa's husband Jimmy called police in a panic to report their disappearance and directed them to a nearby shopping center.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On Halloween night 2004, Adriane Insogna and Leslie Mazzara were brutally murdered in their Napa, California home.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teen was killed by her parents in what they said was self-defense, but forensic evidence told otherwise.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 3-year-old son of parents in Dripping Springs, Texas develops a respiratory condition. Then the father develops signs of Alzheimer's disease, and an investigator reveals that their ill health is due to a form of black mold in their modern home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1995, Debora Green lost two children in a fire that burnt down her Prairie Village, Kansas mansion. Routine procedures occurred and both Debora and her previous husband Michael Farrar were questioned. Suspicions arose when Debora refused to cooperate during questioning. Police then questioned Michael and uncovered disturbing stories proving Debora was dangerous.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A six-year-old girl ran and hid when she saw her grandmother being beaten to death, but the man followed, beat and assaulted her. She said the assailant was her uncle, who was convicted. She recanted her testimony years later.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1983, two young boys were found tied and murdered with similar wounds within three months of each other in two Nebraska towns. The rope used to tie the boys was unique. Another clue turned up when one of the boy's brother was hypnotized and remembered a uniformed man in a tan car.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: One year after her father's death, a teen's role in a high school production of "Hamlet" causes her to reveal the chilling truth behind her family's tragedy.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1967, Lori Keidel, her two sisters and her brother were left home alone while their father went to a nearby laundromat. Suddenly, a large blaze engulfed their brick ranch home, killing Lori's sisters. Only a few months earlier, the children's mother disappeared, and had made no effort to contact them. In 1993, Lori found the courage to tell police the vision that had possessed her for 29 years: that Lori had witnessed her mother's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A patrol officer is shocked by the amount of blood at a traffic accident and is shocked by the coroner's ruling until an anonymous phone call re-ignites the case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In an affluent suburb of Philadelphia, police were called to the scene of what appeared to be an accidental drowning. The investigation gradually focused on one person, a suspect who had more than a million reasons to want the victim dead.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Authorities track a kidnapper who allowed his victim, 17-year-old Shari Smith, to write a last will and testament on a note pad, then informed the family of her murder, as well as the later murder of a 10-year-old Debra May Helmick. A phone number written on a previous page left a lasting impression, which helped to convict Larry Gene Bell.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, 16-month-old Anne Grace Gimmenstad became very ill, was rushed to the hospital and died within two weeks. Following extensive medical examinations, it was determined that Anna had been the victim of the deadly bacteria E.coli.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police investigation of a pediatrician, after the mysterious death of one of her patients, leads them to a Texas hospital where the pediatric mortality rate was higher than at any hospital in the country. The common link was nurse Genene Jones, but proving the connection seems impossible until an international team of doctors uncovers an unlikely murder weapon.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Heavy rains and snow run-off carry manure into Milwaukee's water supply in 1993, leading to an epidemic of gastrointestinal illness affecting 400,000 people.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Krista Harrison is the 11-year-old murder victim of Robert Anthony Buell. There are few clues to the killer's identity, but authorities are intrigued by unusual orange fibers embedded in clothing found near the victim. Months go by and the case goes cold, until a van turns up with what appear to be the same orange fibers.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On Halloween night 2004, Adriane Insogna and Leslie Mazzara were brutally murdered in their Napa, California home.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On September 17, 1984, in a suburb of Tucson, Arizona, eight-year-old Vicki Hoskins left home on her pink bicycle to mail a letter for her mother. She never returned, but her slightly damaged bicycle was found nearby. Investigators turned to forensic science, in the hope it would tell them not only what happened to Vicki, but also who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of 9-year-old Jessica Knott is investigated. Investigators use a garbage bag to connect suspect James Edward Crow, Jr. to the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a day of fishing in a small, quiet village in Switzerland, a teenage boy did not return home as planned. The investigation revealed some important microscopic evidence in the water near where he was last seen. It was the only forensic evidence detectives had. But would it be enough for them to find him?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1983, two young boys were found tied and murdered with similar wounds within three months of each other in two Nebraska towns. The rope used to tie the boys was unique. Another clue turned up when one of the boy's brother was hypnotized and remembered a uniformed man in a tan car.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An assistant manager of a Florida steakhouse is stabbed to death. It appears to be a robbery gone wrong, but a bloody fingerprint reveals that he knew his killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1967, Lori Keidel, her two sisters and her brother were left home alone while their father went to a nearby laundromat. Suddenly, a large blaze engulfed their brick ranch home, killing Lori's sisters. Only a few months earlier, the children's mother disappeared, and had made no effort to contact them. In 1993, Lori found the courage to tell police the vision that had possessed her for 29 years: that Lori had witnessed her mother's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nancy Newman and her two young daughters are found brutally murdered and sexually violated in their Anchorage, AK home. Investigators cannot find a conclusive link to their prime suspect. To solve the puzzle, an FBI analyst designs an unique experiment, in which pubic hairs found at the scene are used to establish not only that Kirby Anthoney was in the home, but that he was there when the crime was committed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This series profiles intriguing crimes where science catches the bad guy. Follow coroners, medical examiners, physicians, law enforcement officials, journalists and legal experts as they put together the pieces of the crime puzzle.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Scientists and detectives use DNA to solve a string of rapes and murders.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a prosecutor discovers evidence linking a habitual drunk driver to a hit-and-run in which a child is killed, he combines the talents of an accident reconstruction expert with a video specialist. This case was the first in which video in the courtroom withstood an appeal, and helped make 'video testimony' viable in other cases.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A fan of murder mysteries and forensic science shows uses what she learned from TV to determine who was responsible for the accident which permanently injured her 4-year-old daughter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Krista Harrison is the 11-year-old murder victim of Robert Anthony Buell. programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For six years, a serial killer prowled the streets of New York City. He wrote letters to police and The New York Post, indicating he would kill twelve people, one for each astrological sign.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On September 17, 1984, in a suburb of Tucson, Arizona, eight-year-old Vicki Hoskins left home on her pink bicycle to mail a letter for her mother. programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In a search for the killer of two teenagers in Texas, a behavioral profile led to suspect Jason Massey _ and hard science proved the profile was correct. Massey was executed by lethal injection on April 3, 2001.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Rachael Mullenix, 19, was convicted of stabbing her mother, Barbara Mullenix, on Sept. 13, 2006, and then packing her bloodied corpse in a cardboard box before dumping it in Newport Bay on the California coast.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into a brutal attack on two boys near a pond relies on evidence fished out of the murky water. It was the first case where Diatom evidence was used to place a suspect at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Rosemary Anderson is found dead on the side of the road, her boyfriend becomes the prime suspect. He eventually confessed to her murder, but so did another man _ serial killer, Eric Edgar Cooke.

programme.title: Celebrity Crime Files
programme.desc: Blasting on the scene in October of 1966 in Oakland, California, the Black Panther Party were a subversive civil rights group who became international sensations with a �freedom by any means necessary philosophy.� Along the way they empowered a generation but they also raised a lot of hell, tangled with police forces across the nation and were eventually public enemy number of the FBI�s infamous COINTELPRO program, which essentially targeted and wiped out numerous African American organizations. CCF looks at the life and crimes of its founders Huey P. Newton and Bobby Seale and its shining princess, the great Angela Davis.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: After a deady night-time home invasion, the family suspects a vindictive ex-lover, but the case grows cold after the suspect disappears; thirty years later, a family member hungry for justice helps police track down the vengeful killer.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: A man is found dead from a single gunshot wound to the chest, and at first friends suspect a possible suicide. But when investigators find evidence that points to foul play, a vindictive ex obsessed with revenge emerges as the prime suspect.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When the body of Angela Alex is discovered on a secluded road, family and friends are left desperate for answers. As they dig deeper, they learn that appearances aren’t always what they seem—and for some, a secret just might be worth killing for.

programme.desc: For D.C. native Yolanda Baker, two things mattered most in life—helping those in need and being there for her family. But when she goes missing after a family event, police begin an investigation that will keep the community on edge for a decade.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: A Civil Rights landmark and the birthplace of rock ‘n roll, Memphis, Tennessee is the quintessential American South. When a beloved local NBA star is found shot to death in the woods, the city bands together to avenge their fallen hero.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: New Orleans a city drenched in history, culture, and the arts. However, it is also shrouded in a dark history of crime. When police find a beloved local gospel singer shot dead in the street, their investigation leads to more questions than answers.

programme.title: Celebrity Crime Files
programme.desc: There is a long list of people who died on the frontlines fighting for social justice for African-Americans. But there are three iconic men whose names remain legendary. Malcolm. Martin. Medgar. Just their first name is enough to make a nation remember the volatile 1960�s when these three bright stars and champions of civil rights were cut down in their prime. Their efforts, and those of the people who supported them and continued their work, have resulted in significant, groundbreaking changes. CCF explores the life and crimes of three titans.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: A church reverend follows the sound of gunshots and finds a young woman fighting for her life. Witnesses tell investigators the victim had been involved in a dramatic parking lot brawl earlier that day, had one of the women come back for payback?

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: When a pregnant Florida teen vanishes without a trace, her family immediately suspects the baby�s father who wanted revenge after she refused an abortion. But with the clock ticking and little evidence, will they be able to find justice?

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When mother-daughter duo Cherie Adams and Curtria Duncan are found brutally stabbed to death in their burning Chicago apartment, both the community and police force are left stunned—why would anyone want to hurt this quiet, friendly pair? programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: After love blooms slowly, Katie Roberts knows that she’s found the one. With a loving partner and happy family life, Katie’s life seems to be pure bliss. programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: Jennifer Brundage finds the love of her life and when distance threatens to keep them apart, she goes to great lengths to keep him. Chade Harris has always played by the rules, until she meets a man that takes her on an unlawful ride.

programme.title: Bloomberg Primer
programme.desc: Governments and entrepreneurs race to commercialize the moon; the efforts could unlock a new, deep-space economy, but to return and stay requires the highest levels of innovation.

programme.title: Quantum Marketing
programme.desc: Stephen Pretorious, chief technology officer of WPP, unpacks the world of generative artificial intelligence and its potential impact, both positive and negative, on marketing.

programme.title: Insight with Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: In a volatile and unpredictable world, the show will be the definitive guide for the global news audience to get the complete picture on the biggest story of the day. With news making executives, officials and thought-leaders from the world of business, politics and academia we will explore a story through probing interviews and nuanced conversations. The hour of programming will also highlight the most relevant stories from India which is currently one of the hottest investment destinations, but also has compelling stories that play into the Bloomberg's priority issues such as Climate change, Diversity and Technological innovation.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa
programme.desc: A spotlight on the fast paced growth and major deals happening across the Middle East and Africa. Linking the market drivers from overnight in the US and across Asia into the region's trading day, with deep dive analysis of the top business, energy and geopolitical stories shaping the decisions of traders across the Middle East, Africa and beyond.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: From London, essential morning viewing to stay ahead of the day's market trends with news stories from the U.S. and Asia in the lead-up to the opening of European markets.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Opening Trade
programme.desc: The Opening Trade has everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. With analysis you won't find anywhere else, we break down the biggest stories of the day and speak to top guests who have skin in the game. Hosted by Anna Edwards, Guy Johnson and Kriti Gupta.

programme.desc: Jonathan, Lisa and Annmarie survey the economy and global markets with daily conversations with leaders and decision makers, from Wall Street to Washington and beyond, to cover the latest in business, investment and geopolitics.

programme.desc: Delivering the market-moving news anyone needs to know to get a jump start on the U.S. trading day.

programme.desc: Technology is not only becoming an increasingly important part of people's lives but also of the American economy. "Bloomberg Technology" takes a look at how the latest happenings in the tech industry are affecting the U.S. markets. Analysis, commentary, interviews and interactive graphics are among the staples of the show that help viewers understand the impact the technology sector has on the economy. The show, which was originally titled "Bloomberg West," is anchored by Emily Chang in San Francisco.

programme.title: Bloomberg Real Yield
programme.desc: Not everyone has a lot of money to invest, which is why Bloomberg has financial indices that are based on fixed income, which is also the focus on this weekly show. The program covers news and trends in the fixed-income market and includes interviews with guests from major financial institutions. "Bloomberg Real Yield" incorporates data and analysis from terminal bond experts to help dive into topics that are moving the bond markets in order to help empower viewers to make knowledgeable financial decisions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Next Africa
programme.desc: A monthly deep dive into Africa's biggest stories through a Bloomberg lens. Global investors see the continent as one of the top areas for opportunity and growth, and some African nations are well-positioned to be global hubs for development. This show will discuss key steps taken to help deliver on Africa's quest of bridging the gap with global powers, and track capital flows and the direction of funds amid the underlying political, economic and social developments.

programme.title: Easy Money: Fraud, Fortune and Failures
programme.desc: (2021) With nearly 15 hours of interviews from 17 people – and dozens of hours of news footage — Easy Money tells the story of what is being called the worst fraud in California history.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A teenager vanishes from her home one fall morning in 1999. Her body is discovered 17 days later, seven miles away. It takes more than 15 years for the heartbreaking truth to come out.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: A taekwondo master on a mission to empower women, a high school football star making his family proud, and a soccer club smashing stereotypes personify the best of Sacramento.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie invite you along for a fabulous day of decadence and pampering at some of their favorite “treat yo-self” spots in Sactown.

programme.title: Mo Gaba: Spirit Lives Forever
programme.desc: How a child living with cancer changed the Baltimore sports community forever.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact focuses on issues facing youth. We travel to a rural California high school where teachers are coming together to address teen mental health. Plus, the Luddite Club founders explain why they gave up smartphones and social media. And, the high cost of college is prompting young adults to consider other options.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: More than money makes the crime world go round. You won’t believe the odd array of goods that have been stolen over the years -- and the motivations behind the thefts.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Michael Ferrazzani, creator of Ya Mamma’s sauce, challenges the North End born Italian stallion, Chef Kenny Palazzolo, to a true neighborhood duel. Can Michael’s Grandma inspired dish bring down the chef who lives, laughs and cooks Italian?

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero takes to the streets to ask people about the wildest, wackiest news stories. In "Odd Jobs," contestants learn about a kid-run food truck, a school board member with a special license and a senior citizen that's into heavy work.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find a book about choosing weird, a torch-wielding craftswoman, and a family bakery burning the midnight oil? The same place where alleyways have meaningful names and the American River changed the course of triathlons.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Having a little fun on the town is great but it's even better when you're doing it thriftily. Join Maddy & Dixie as they make a little cash go a long way, seeking out the best activities that’ll have you ballin’ on a budget!

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Visit a peachy brewery that uses local farm ingredients, then devour a massive biscuit sandwich. In Lexington, South Carolina you can have a close encounter with an exotic animal at a drive-thru safari before checking into an Italian villa in the heart of downtown.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Three years after his double amputation, Jeff in Albuquerque is ready to reconnect with nature. Kinga is there to root him on as he takes on challenging and inspiring outdoor adventures.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Chefs Nate Schoedel and Ivan Gil-Silva are casting their nets for the best Catch of the Day dishes in today's seafood showdown. Can our chefs reel in a victory? Or will they let the big one get away?

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Follow Maddy & Dixie as they go on a historical tour around iconic Sacramento locales. Learn how the city was raised during floods. And check out the famous banana cream pie at Frank Fats.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Heists that are so bold, brazen and audacious you have to see them to believe them. But in the world of crime, audacity doesn’t always pay.

programme.title: Widowed At 19
programme.desc: Two high school sweethearts had their love story cut too short.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Food does more than fuel our bodies, it connects us. Every bite allows us to share cultures. create memories and celebrate traditions.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: Shift: The Ragbrai Documentary
programme.desc: A celebration of the oldest, largest, and longest recreational touring bicycle ride in the world. Three riders and a pair of community leaders reach new personal heights, changing their lives along the seven day ride across Iowa.

programme.title: The Lost Children of Carlisle
programme.desc: A powerful look at the history of Native American boarding schools as told through the stories of tribal members and their surviving family members, who endured an educational system founded on the concept “Kill the Indian in him, and save the man.”

programme.title: Easy Money: Fraud, Fortune and Failures
programme.desc: (2021) With nearly 15 hours of interviews from 17 people – and dozens of hours of news footage — Easy Money tells the story of what is being called the worst fraud in California history.

programme.title: Always Remember Your Name
programme.desc: A documentary of mistaken identity, hope, love, and the power of story by two Holocaust survivors.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Sometimes the bad guys are busted by regular people! These stories showcase good Samaritans stopping suspects in their tracks.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Glenda Macatangay has conquered her career and being a single mom to four kids. But when it comes to being comfortable in the outdoors, she isn’t as confident. Kinga meets up with Glenda in Sacramento, CA to introduce her to the wonders of the wilderness.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Karla, a devoted mother and doting grandmother has had her fair share of obstacles from two bouts of cancer to caring for her husband and daughter. Karla embarks on a much needed day of pampering, seeking solace and self-care.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train

programme.desc: We explore how entrepreneurs reduce waste, enhance recycling and transform reused materials into unique goods. These efforts craft a sustainable tomorrow.

programme.title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy

programme.title: A Son Snaps
programme.desc: After years of abuse, a high school valedictorian snaps, viciously stabbing his mother and leaving her for dead in the family's garage. Leaving behind zero forensic evidence at the crime scene, he almost gets away with her savage murder, except for a couple small inconsistencies in his alibi that reveal his true plans.

programme.title: Trailer Park Tragedy
programme.desc: A bizarre lover's triangle turns lethal and a mother of two suddenly disappears. Cops investigate the missing person's case but soon discover it's the coldest of coldhearted murders committed by two jilted ex-lovers.

programme.title: A Fugitive And A Killer
programme.desc: When one bodybuilder wants what another bodybuilder has, the end result is a murder-for-hire. The muscle-bound mastermind goes on the lam for nearly a decade only to resurface half a world away and kill a police officer before law enforcement brings him to justice.

programme.title: The Happy Face Killer
programme.desc: A long-haul trucker with a lust for killing crisscrosses the country looking for his next victim. Police don't connect any of this serial murderer's crimes until he slips up and takes out someone from his inner circle.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Two couples sample bites from around the world, cozy up in nature, get hopped up on caffeine and seek out a yoga glow on two blind dates in Orlando.

programme.title: 60 Min Documentaries
programme.desc: A playlist of hour long VL Originals

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Ivan Gomez is on a weight loss journey, but it’s one that’s been limited to exercising in his home. Kinga meets Ivan in Stockton, CA to show him how the outdoors can be a personal gym for body, mind and spirit.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: We explore how entrepreneurs reduce waste, enhance recycling and transform reused materials into unique goods. These efforts craft a sustainable tomorrow.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Chefs Jessica Peconi and Dee Dixon are getting saucy in today’s cooking challenge. Can the chefs craft the most savory dips, dressings, or relish? Or will they get Lost in the Sauce?

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: The team travels to Vermont to host a memorial concert for a young man gone too soon.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A beloved University of Kentucky football player is murdered on the porch of his house during his 21st birthday party in an assassination-style killing. What leads to the shooter's capture is equally shocking.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Host Frank Nicotero visits "The Big Easy" armed with trivia questions about the unbelievable things people have seen in a bottle, under a church floorboard and even inside a mail truck!

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From stealing an ambulance after leaving a hospital to hijacking a helicopter for the sake of love, these criminals have odd motives and even odder methods of executing them.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Veteran NYC Chef Ten Vong squares up against Jimmy's Famous Seafood rep Charlie Wickboldt. Watch these chefs transform their colorful careers into even more colorful plates. Who will find the tomato trophy at the end of the rainbow?

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Greg hangs out with world champion gymnast, Chellsie Memmel, as they explore the Olympic history of Milwaukee. They meet up with other Olympians, including Gold medalist Bonnie Blair, for an exciting day of gymnastics, speed skating, and more!

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Young, single, and new to Sacramento, Aurora knows what she wants and goes after it. Three Sacramento bachelors will try to win her over with a day of tango lessons, wood working and a jam session.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Join Amanda and comedian Sarah Kennedy on a journey that tests their limits–or at least makes them a little uncomfortable. From slippery footing to slithery friends, they push themselves and live to delight in Albuquerque another day.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob proves that this iconic locale is more than just Ivy League. He makes pasta from scratch, crafts a custom knife and tries to make an escape from one of the toughest spots in all of Beantown.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Whether it’s gathering thousands of mysterious, colorful packets stuffed in a store’s ceiling or valuable wildlife slithering to freedom, investigators must be ready to decisively face a range of mammoth tasks in the field.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Love hurts: These are real-life stories of Americans who were swindled by people who claimed to love them.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day try their hand at pottery and make pretzels in a 150 year old oven before toasting their day at Carson Street Deli & Craft Beer Bar in the Southside.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Explore a historic cave with timeless messages on its walls. Savor every last crumb of a Cookie Monster waffle. Test your putt-putt skills on a hole designed to get the better of you.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Joe Lugosch is a 31-year-old Mainer who is tired of living on the edge and partying too hard. With the help of Kinga, Joe will get a new perspective on the world outside and change his habits for good.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: These local experts are passionate about Orlando. The Magic’s DJ D-Strong shares his go-to cocktail spot. Lindsay from Lemonhearted dishes on her favorite destination for vegan treats. And, Equity Ben shows you where to cool off.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: You can feel the love on this week’s culinary showdown. Chef Amy Mehrtens, Executive Chef of Copper Vine, challenges long-time friend Chef Daren Porretto, Chef de Cuisine at Saint John. While these two go back years, when it comes to competition they’re pulling no punches.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact focuses on issues facing youth. We travel to a rural California high school where teachers are coming together to address teen mental health. programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Uncover the Midwest's unexpected. From quirky to inventive flavor mash-ups like the bulgogi burger to the questionable sour cream & raisin pie, see how the area crafts some interesting but delightful culinary concoctions.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Six people are slain in a home in a quiet Iowa town. One person survives a gunshot to the head and claims to have no memory of the incident. The tragedy and eventual trial shred the social fabric of the neighborhood.

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and “butts up” shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.
